column4: i failed at compiling my own kernel.  but then who can blame me ??  make xconfig needs to be studied.  plus i dont know anything about the celeron d other than its 686 with EM64T though i'm running 32-bit.  crazy.
you don't need to do anything related to the celeron.  just pick it off the menu.
doesn't matter, compile for i386.  It's possibly a slight downgrade but it will certainly run.
you don't really need to change anything.
